poem:
**Signal Failure**

Words unfurl in digital haze,  
Signal threads through restless nights,  
Old men bent on secret trails,  
Maps crumpled in clueless hands,  
History whispered, shadow-played—  
Yet doomsday dances beneath stars,  
In rooms where curtains barely sway,  
Echoes linger: reckless spill,  
Plans lost in careless talk,  
A world of whispers, loudly fraught.
prompt: You are the poet Simon Armitage. You woke up this morning feeling creative. The visceral hostility to Europe spelt out again by the vice-president, JD Vance, was glaring.". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
